definition: to crown/coronation
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
crown in the form of a horizontal board with hanging decorations/imperial crown

sentences.english: 1328 - Philip VI is crowned King of France.
sentences.chinese: 1328年的今天，腓力六世加冕成为法兰西国王。

sentences.english: 1547- Ivan the Terrible was crowned Czar of Russia.
sentences.chinese: 1547年的今天，伊凡雷帝加冕为俄国沙皇。

sentences.english: 1838 - The coronation of Victoria of the United Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 1838年的今天，英格兰维多利亚女王举行加冕礼。

sentences.english: The King was enthroned in the church.
The crowning of the May Day Queen was often the centre of celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 五月女皇加冕礼是整个庆祝活动的核心部分。

sentences.english: British kings are crowned in Westminster Abbey.
sentences.chinese: 历代英国国王皆在西敏寺行加冕礼。

sentences.english: King Vajiralongkorn's coronation will take place at some point after that.
sentences.chinese: 哇集拉隆功国王的加冕礼将放在那之后。

sentences.english: In June 1533, Anne was crowned queen.
sentences.chinese: 1533年六月，安妮被加冕为乐王后。

sentences.english: So he is remembering being crowned emperor.
sentences.chinese: 他想起了被加冕的记忆。

sentences.english: 1066 – Harold Godwinson is crowned King of England.
sentences.chinese: 1066年的今天，哈罗德二世加冕成为英格兰国王。

sentences.english: 1483 - Richard III is crowned king of England.
sentences.chinese: 1483年的今天，理查三世加冕为英格兰国王。

sentences.english: 1328 - King Philip VI of France is crowned.
sentences.chinese: 1328年的今天，法兰西国王菲利浦六世加冕。

sentences.english: The coronation of the new king was a splendid pageant。
sentences.chinese: 新国王的加冕典礼非常壮观。

sentences.english: Where did he rank among the league's all-time greatest scorers?
sentences.chinese: 他是在哪里加冕全联盟史上最伟大得分手的？

sentences.english: 1654 - Louis XIV is crowned King of France.
sentences.chinese: 1654年的今天，路易十四世加冕为法兰西国王。

sentences.english: And he wasn't crowned emperor; Napoleon was crowned emperor.
sentences.chinese: 但他没有被加冕的经历，拿破仑有。

definition: laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
trophy cup
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
crown
to win a championship/to come out top/to take the cup
throne
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
(winner's) podium
honor/credit/glory/(honorable) reputation/honorary
to defend the crown (in sports championship)
to set up/to establish
grand slam
champion/CL:個|个[ge4]
title/rank/appellation
